channel.title: Is there a free jdbc host?
channel.description: I need a jdbc host. Are there any free ones?

item.title: Is there a free jdbc host?
item.dc:creator: @Fasga Fasga
item.description:
@Fasga wrote:

If you’re doing anything where time is of the essence, I would advise running the MySQL locally, or on the same box as the app in question is running on. Having to query to a remote host can really slow down your application, and it isn’t too hard installing MySQL.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a free jdbc host?

item.title: Is there a free jdbc host?
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

Most free hosts will support it. Are you sure you are using the connector right?

... Class.forName( "com.mysql.jdbc.Driver" ).newInstance(); Connection connection = DriverManager.getConnection( "jdbc:mysql://server/database?user=username&password=password" ); ...

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a free jdbc host?

item.title: Is there a free jdbc host?
item.dc:creator: @Fasga Fasga
item.description:
@Fasga wrote:

JDBC stands for Java Database Connectivity. It isn’t an actual service. It is more of an abstraction layer that you can use with a few different types of SQL servers. What you’re probably looking for is a free web host that offers MySQL, as that is the most common type of SQL server.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a free jdbc host?
